|brand = Nikon |model = WU-1a |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = November 11, 2012 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Nikon_WU-1a |sernum = <!-- Serial number prefix --> |wlclass = N150 |series = <!-- Device series --> |if = not actually a wireless adapter |if_bus_version = <!-- ie. 1.0, 1.1, 2.0, 2.2 --> |ifconnector = <!-- Interface Connector Type, Leave blank for none --> |formfactor = <!-- Connector Form Factor, Leave blank for none -->
|vendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |device_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = CGJ2148EA |icid = <!-- Industry Canada ID, Leave blank for none --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = <!-- OUI -->
|chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43362; |chip2 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 1 |sstreams = 1 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 150 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->
|linuxdriv = |windriv =
|is_manuf = No |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |flags = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category =
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 04/18/2012 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = Japan
|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== This device serves as a portable access point for the '''Nikon''' D3200 camera allowing pictures to be taken remotely with an Android phone.
This device contains a '''STMicroelectronics''' microcontroller (STM32F205), a '''STMicroelectronics''' USB OTG transciever, and a '''Broadcom''' wireless chip (BCM43362).
Internal / external pictures, lsusb output: [https://nikonhacker.com/wiki/WU-1a]
==Links of Interest== [http://hackaday.com/2012/11/10/nikon-wu-1a-wifi-dongle-hacking/ Nikon WU-1a WiFi dongle hacking on '''Hack a Day'''] :[https://docs.google.com/presentation/pub?id=1Yi2uh3s12IFe024xsMrO-jwut-NEjDoaIl8DzmaRE_g#slide=id.g3a08561d_1_27 Hacking the Nikon WU-1a] (slides) ::"F205RG6", "8NME5VG", and "SGR201Y" appears to be on the '''STM''' microcontroller. ::BCM43362KUBG is on the '''Broadcom''' wireless chip. This is a BCM43362.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
